page.title: 08TURLIN MOOR RECLAMATION
page.content: { Several years ago, Poole Generating Station proposed to dump 50,000 tons of ash a year into the sea on the Poole coast. The local authorities were afraid that this might harm the fish so the Corporation bought 82 acres land at Turlin Moor to use as playing fields and allowed the CEGB to dump the ash on it up to a depth of 12 feet. By 1959, 29 acres of Turlin Moor had been reclaimed and 14.5 acres were laid out as playing fields. When the power station changed to burning oil, the ash supply stopped. The reclamation was continued by the dumping of rubbish from the destructor.
